## `library(tidyverse)` will load  
## the core tidyverse packages: 

#### [ggplot2](http://ggplot2.tidyverse.org), for data visualisation.
#### [dplyr](http://dplyr.tidyverse.org), for data manipulation.
#### [tidyr](http://tidyr.tidyverse.org), for data tidying.
#### [readr](http://readr.tidyverse.org), for data import.
#### [purrr](http://purrr.tidyverse.org), for functional programming.
#### [tibble](http://tibble.tidyverse.org), for tibbles, a modern re-imagining of data frames.
#### [stringr](https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr), for strings.
#### [forcats](https://github.com/hadley/forcats), for factors.

#  Review: writing functions

```{r, eval = FALSE}
x <- x^2
x <- scale(x)
x <- max(x)
```

---

#  Review: writing functions

```{r, eval = FALSE}
x <- x^2
x <- scale(x)
x <- max(x)

y <- x^2
y <- scale(y)
y <- max(y)

z <- z^2
z <- scale(x)
z <- max(z)
```

---


#  Review: writing functions

```{r, eval = FALSE}
x <- x^2
x <- scale(x)
x <- max(x)

y <- x^2 #<<
y <- scale(y)
y <- max(y)

z <- z^2
z <- scale(x) #<<
z <- max(z)
```

---

#  Review: writing functions

```{r, eval = FALSE}
x <- x^3 #<<
x <- scale(x)
x <- max(x)

y <- x^2 #<<
y <- scale(y)
y <- max(y)

z <- z^2 #<<
z <- scale(x)
z <- max(z)
```

---

#  Review: writing functions

```{r, eval = FALSE}
.f <- function(x) {
  x <- x^3
  x <- scale(x)
  
  max(x)
}

.f(x)
.f(y)
.f(z)
```

# Returning types

|  map |  returns |
|:--|:--|
|`map()` | list |
|`map_chr()` | character vector |
|`map_dbl()` | double vector (numeric) |
|`map_int()` | integer vector |
|`map_lgl()` | logical vector |
|`map_dfc()` | data frame (by column) |
|`map_dfr()` | data frame (by row) |

# map2()

```{r,eval=FALSE}
gapminder_countries <- split(gapminder, gapminder$country)
models <- map(gapminder_countries, ~ lm(lifeExp ~ year, data = .))
preds <- map2(models, gapminder_countries, predict)
head(preds, 3)
```

## Loops vs functional programming

```{r, eval=FALSE}
x <- rnorm(10)
y <- map(x, mean)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
x <- rnorm(10)
y <- vector("list", length(x))
for (i in seq_along(x)) {
  y[[i]] <- mean(x[[i]])
}
```

---
